result.execSummary:
The defendant Kris P Krisik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.  No possession of illicit drugs or medications without a valid prescription/ medications must be taken as directed.  DE will maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with victims CJ-dob 3/02/1999 or CS-dob 0/04/1998 or any underage females.

DE must maintain employment.
DE will comply with S.O.R.P per sec 301.45
DE will provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge

You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Defendant Kris P Krisik in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CM69.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Atty Cohen recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea on CT's 1 and 2 in 14CF67.  

Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  

14CF67
Ct 1- amended ct, plea of G, Court accepts and finds DE G. 
 Impose/Stay 8 yrs prison, 4 yrs in/4 yrs out.  5 years probation, will serve 9 months jail, credit for 93 days on prison sentence, will have huber, CC, will register with sex offender registry, provide DNA sample, pay restitution of $161.96 with 10% surcharge, no contact with CJ or CS or any underage female, maintain full time employment, maintain all bond conditions, will commence jail 11-01-15, complete any programming deemed appropriate by DOC, no alochol or drugs, no bars etc, prescribed meds taken only as directed, 

Ct 2-amended ct, plea of G, Court accepts and finds DE G.  Withhold sentence 6 yrs probation, concurrent to Ct 1, CC, DNA sample, Sex Offender Registry, compete any programming deemed appropriate by DOC.

Defendant Kris P Krisik in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  Andrea Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CM69.   Atty/DE will waive prelim hearing for today's hearing, Atty then wishes to proceed to arraignment.  Court instructs on waiver of prelim hearing, court is satisfied will accept waiver of prelim, court will find probable cause and bind over for JT.  Waive reading of the amended information, enter pleas of NG to all counts.   Set for review 12-17-14 @ 1:00PM.  Atty wishes to address the issue of bond modification, lays out the additional requirements his client would be required to do.  State opposes any bond modification.  Court will order a $2500.00 cash bond, must reside with his mother, will be at his mother's home the hours of 9:00PM to 6:00AM, will remain in Rusk County and contiguous counties only, unless given permission by the court to leave, will report in person to the Rusk County Jail at there discretion, no contact with minor children, CLJ,  CJS or there immediate families.  If night employment if obtained, DE is to contact his attorney immediately.
